summary: The Personalized Care Act of 2025 aims to expand and improve Health Savings Accounts (HSAs). Key provisions include broadening HSA eligibility to include various health plans and health care sharing ministries, increasing contribution limits, allowing HSA funds to be used for health plan and insurance premiums, and clarifying the treatment of medical care service arrangements and health care sharing ministry fees. The bill also reduces the penalty for nonqualified HSA distributions.
